Ant=C3=B3nio> stored" can perfectly refer to a data-handling
    Ant=C3=B3n=
io> process.

No, that's not the meaning in English. This is the meaning of=
 POST:

  The POST method is used to request that the origin server accept
=
  the entity enclosed in the request as data to be processed by of
  the re=
source identified by the Request-URI in the


    Ant=C3=B3nio> However I t=
hink that "be stored" shouldn't be interpreted
    Ant=C3=B3nio> in "strict=
-sensu", like I think we should not think of
    Ant=C3=B3nio> GET/POST/PUT=
/DELETE as CRUD...

It should be, because PUT is idempotent, while POST is =
not.
